I've had this game for nearly its entire life. I love making things in creative and enjoyed when survival first released. However in the last few years I can't help think its been abandoned. The most recent update was from December 5, 2024, and the one before that over a year earlier. This was my first steam game and the reason I got steam. I think of it as Minecraft creative mode but with gravity and cars. The physics sometimes make no sense which is frustrating to say the least, if you want to make something complex. The recent update tried to fix this but not much noticeable difference. I recommend this game because I've had a lot of good times on it, but it is in no way a complete game and wish the devs would give us something new.

I've been playing this game since it first came out and it is one of the most fun vehicle building games I have ever experienced. I love the survival aspects with the building, it really makes for a fun playthrough. It gets a little lonely with just myself, therefore it's much more fun with friends. Chapter 2 has been in development since 2020, FIVE years ago! Now that's a long time for one update, and the community knows it. It takes a long time for updates most likely because not many people play it still. It is sad to see one of my favorite games become so desolate with the player base. I know there are still people who have fun in this game, but it isn't what it was like five years ago. The vision for this game is incredible, and I wish they added more content to survival so the endgame doesn't come so quickly where there is no incentive to keep playing. I always hit a roadblock with this game because I don't have any motivation to keep playing since there is nothing left to do besides screw around in creative. For new players this game is pretty daunting mostly because they don't get into it enough to really have fun with the mechanics of the game/survival mode. Overall very awesome game, 8/10.

Creative mode's a god-mode fever dream: 400+ parts for walking mechs or shark-bait submarines, mods pumping thousands more for infinite "why did I build this?" moments. It's a good and fun game as it is, albeit incomplete. The sandbox and building aspects to it give you quite a lot of potential play time and content, and I don't regret purchasing or playing the game at all.

On the other hand, I don't think I'd recommend to someone to purchase it. It's kind of in Schrodinger's Development right now. It may or may not be abandoned? Axolot doesn't seem to make the slightest effort to reassure the community that it still is in active development, much less than in what capacity. Perhaps they are all working diligently in the background to finally release Chapter 2, but I find it to be an awfully strange and suspicious management decision to basically go radio silent for the last few years. There was a small update almost a year ago, but I don't necessarily find it convincing that the game is still being worked on.

I'm going to be honest, this is only negative because of one crucial thing:
The lack of communication.
This game is great, the community content is amazing, and the past few updates have been good, but there's little to no communication about the status of the game, not even updates that address bugs that people experienced.

Chapter 2 for the main part of the game has been announced several YEARS ago, and it's no closer than what we have now. It's great when it does releases, but just like most other games that enter EA, it's a gamble.

If you do want a game with some stuff to do, go for it, but if you want to try out the fun challenge mode, or play the countless community made maps, creations, and so on, go for that too, it's amazing.

There's been little from the developers, and keep in mind, it's been nearly a year since the "physics and wedges" update, and a year before that since the last major update, and 9 months before that. It's... not been great in terms of release, sure it takes time but a "hey we're still here" every once in a while would be nice. Addressing issues on the steam forums would be nice every once in a while for the community.

This game could go above and beyond, but it's only going above at the moment and not beyond.

I do not recommend this game because not only is the dev communication poor, but it's unfinished and may never -be- finished.

And six years later?  I highly doubt it will be.

TLDR: This game hasn't received meaningful official content for 5+ years, existing content is very rudimentary or unpolished, and radio silence for the past 2+ years.

Scrap mechanic is a solid physics sandbox with survival elements, but most of those survival elements are either extremely basic or are desperately missing polish, i would suggest this game if you're the type to experiment with the game's physics and build cool stuff, but if you're coming here with hopes for a full-blown survival game, you'd have better luck playing modded Minecraft.

The game's content problem is partially mitigated by the small, but very persistent modding scene, which has a fair amount of modifications to the game's survival mode with their own features (Shoutout to Crashlander devs and 00Fant) but that means the game, as it stands now, is SINGLE-HANDEDLY carried by the community.

Not to mention that Axolot hasn't given us a SINGLE devblog or progress report SINCE 2023 at the time of this review, so i wouldn't hold my breath waiting for new stuff to drop. I'd even go and say you should not buy this game unless you're fine with what content the game offers right now, as the game's future does not look bright at this time.
Game itself is decent but I cannot recommend since it's still early access after 9 years of release. Updates are coming so slow that you will die of old age before the game is ready.

Sadly Disappointed.....    **NO AUDIO**

   I have had this game wishlisted for awhile and finally decided to add it to my library. Installed without any problems and loaded things up with excitement about my upcoming experience. The title screen shows and after a few seconds I notice something major is missing.....SOUND! I checked the "Audio" tab in the settings which turned out to be a joke since all it has available is a Volume slider for overall volume control and that was currently maxed out already. I then turned to graphical settings in case there was a setting for muting the audio if the game was not in "focus"... nothing. 

*During this time I had been in a Discord Voice Chat with friends and could hear just them just fine so I knew my audio device was working properly.*

   Realizing my issues must be outside of the game, I did a quick Google search for answers. Those consisted of "Re-install the game" or "Verify the file integrity through Steam" as well as a couple deeper suggestions, the first was going into my PC's Sound Settings under its' advanced section and specifically setting the audio output device/verifying the correct device was selected already. This yielded no results as everything was properly set up. The second deep suggestion was to go into my Command Prompt and dive into the files coding to adjust a numerical value away from 0. Although I know computers, I tend to avoid using a Command Prompt method because when done improperly, things tend to break further..... so I did not explore this method but instead opted for the Verify Files and then finally Re-install. ALL these methods resulted in no fix and me playing an audioless game.

Now the game itself seems fun, for the 30 mins I had it open. I loaded into a survival map and was greeted with a tutorial of sorts but the audio issue made things sorta difficult since my only que's were visual when progressing forward and I could not tell when I was being attacked by enemies. Then my game began to stutter and lag..... bad... I had to close out of the game and it even lagged Steam so hard that the Steam UI broke and I had to restart Steam. This was the straw that broke the camels back.... I had been fiddling with everything for about 2 days and the only route I had not taken was a path I (as a consumer) should not need to take in order to play a video game. All in all I wish I could have enjoyed this game like it was meant to be enjoyed but my experience has been horrendous, the game has been Early Access since 2016, updates seem to have stopped, and ultimately I will be requesting a refund.

P.S. I checked my Audio drivers and verified they were up to date

Scrap Mechanic is a sophisticated and flexible 3D vehicle building engine that refuses to be okay with being that. It's most fun when just making little contraptions in creative mode, and despite an eternal early access, every other mode detracts from that central perfect core. Challenges prevent you from making anything interesting and are mostly used for multiplayer maps with minimal building. Survival doesn't complement the creation gameplay at all and just forces you to grind to get to the actually interesting part. Combat is thoughtless and janky. Farming is uninteresting. Base defense is either tedious or effortlessly solved. Exploration is not rewarded and the procedural worlds are samey. This could have been good, and there's fun to be had, to be fair, but Scrap Mechanic does not succeed as a cohesive whole and everything early access has piled atop it has smothered clever core gameplay.

TLDR: This game hasn't received meaningful official content for 5+ years, existing content is very rudimentary or unpolished, and radio silence for the past 2+ years.

Scrap mechanic is a solid physics sandbox with survival elements, but most of those survival elements are either extremely basic or are desperately missing polish, i would suggest this game if you're the type to experiment with the game's physics and build cool stuff, but if you're coming here with hopes for a full-blown survival game, you'd have better luck playing modded Minecraft.

The game's content problem is partially mitigated by the small, but very persistent modding scene, which has a fair amount of modifications to the game's survival mode with their own features (Shoutout to Crashlander devs and 00Fant) but that means the game, as it stands now, is SINGLE-HANDEDLY carried by the community.

Not to mention that Axolot hasn't given us a SINGLE devblog or progress report SINCE 2023 at the time of this review, so i wouldn't hold my breath waiting for new stuff to drop. I'd even go and say you should not buy this game unless you're fine with what content the game offers right now, as the game's future does not look bright at this time.

   I have had this game wishlisted for awhile and finally decided to add it to my library. Installed without any problems and loaded things up with excitement about my upcoming experience. The title screen shows and after a few seconds I notice something major is missing.....SOUND! I checked the "Audio" tab in the settings which turned out to be a joke since all it has available is a Volume slider for overall volume control and that was currently maxed out already. I then turned to graphical settings in case there was a setting for muting the audio if the game was not in "focus"... nothing. 

*During this time I had been in a Discord Voice Chat with friends and could hear just them just fine so I knew my audio device was working properly.*

   Realizing my issues must be outside of the game, I did a quick Google search for answers. Those consisted of "Re-install the game" or "Verify the file integrity through Steam" as well as a couple deeper suggestions, the first was going into my PC's Sound Settings under its' advanced section and specifically setting the audio output device/verifying the correct device was selected already. This yielded no results as everything was properly set up. The second deep suggestion was to go into my Command Prompt and dive into the files coding to adjust a numerical value away from 0. Although I know computers, I tend to avoid using a Command Prompt method because when done improperly, things tend to break further..... so I did not explore this method but instead opted for the Verify Files and then finally Re-install. ALL these methods resulted in no fix and me playing an audioless game.

Now the game itself seems fun, for the 30 mins I had it open. I loaded into a survival map and was greeted with a tutorial of sorts but the audio issue made things sorta difficult since my only que's were visual when progressing forward and I could not tell when I was being attacked by enemies. Then my game began to stutter and lag..... bad... I had to close out of the game and it even lagged Steam so hard that the Steam UI broke and I had to restart Steam. This was the straw that broke the camels back.... I had been fiddling with everything for about 2 days and the only route I had not taken was a path I (as a consumer) should not need to take in order to play a video game. All in all I wish I could have enjoyed this game like it was meant to be enjoyed but my experience has been horrendous, the game has been Early Access since 2016, updates seem to have stopped, and ultimately I will be requesting a refund.

P.S. I checked my Audio drivers and verified they were up to date

This game has a lot of potential but the fun isn't in the game yet.  Here are some recommendations for what's missing.  

I didn't know that the whole point of the game was to build farms and turn in resources before Googling.  I thought it was to escape the planet due to the crashed ship at the start.  The ship should have more of a point after it's repaired.   Maybe have it land on top of the mechanic's workshop to power it rather than finding a second battery.  A later quest to lead you to the first depot and explain how to connect to the turn in point would be helpful.   

I want to build, not grind resources.  The first car's parts should be handed to you as a reward at the top of the first tower.  Rusty blocks from the haybots could use a 5x multiplier.   I had to Google how to progress since it didn't seem right the game didn't provide the blocks to make the first car and i wasn't sure how else to get them.

Upgrading the constructors doesn't give access to new blocks.  It should start with a smaller set and unlock more blocks with a short tutorial with blocks given.  

The timer for when bots attack a farm should be labeled Farm Assault Incoming and have a mini reminder in the corner of the UI.   

Components are what bars progress in the game.  That make sense that you need that type of system.  However, it shouldn't be needed for building chests.   

Scrap wheels shouldn't make a vehicle that is slower than run speed.   They shouldn't be "good" but they also shouldn't make you want to skip vehicle making in favor of waiting for better parts.   I'd love a traction control part in the future too.   

Blueprints are a must, especially if respawning tape bots can hold your only vehicle hostage.  I ended up stopping at the point this happened because getting more parts without a vehicle wasn't worth it let alone all the armor blocks I now knew I needed.   Before Googling (again) I fully expected character armor because it's not conveyed that the game is designed for vehicle combat.

Perhaps I couldn't find it, but the water dispenser (vacuum pump) seemed to distribute water randomly on crops.  Some kind of sprinkler or controlled distribution system is needed.   

Most other resources are in need of a method of automation.  I didn't find a way to automate oil extraction but perhaps vehicles that drive on the ocean floor are expected.  I didn't see an extension ladder or something to reach the higher honeycomb pieces.   Sure I can make a staircase, but I wouldn't want to drive around with that protuberance on my vehicle all the time.   

I could not find a key modifier to make a 2d plane vertical.  Many times I wanted to make a wall but had to build it one layer at a time.   

Keep up the good work, I look forward to when building feels fun and challenges exist but don't throw you into the deep end and hold your stuff hostage.
